result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heber Daniel Velazquez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Heber Daniel Velazquez appeared by video.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz appeared by video for Heber Daniel Velazquez.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel has offer and discovery and requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Court reminded defendant of current no contact order in place.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
9/29/22.  sb
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MR-A, HMC
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Heber Daniel Velazquez in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 41 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on October 3rd, 2022 @ 1pm.
